page.title: 09CHURCHES
page.content: { St Mary's Church,Slaugham. It was built in the 11th century and was built and opened by the Lord of the Manor.It is a Church of England church and has 8 bells rung by a bell ringing group. The vicar has been there for 6 years. He feels the church is important to the village life because it enables the people to get together and worship God. There is always an 11.00 service on Sundays.The children have Sunday School at a nearby cottage.About 90/100 people come to this service and about 75% are locals. {St Mark's Church, Staplefield. Staplefield church is a nice sized church in pleasant surroundings.The church was designed by Benjamin Ferry and built in 1847.The church is still in good condition considering its age.
